com.leakyabstractions.result

Interface Result<S,F>

  • Type Parameters:
    S - the type of the success value
    F - the type of the failure value

    public interface Result<S,F>
    Represents either the success or failure of an operation, including an associated value in each case.

    On the one hand, a result object conveys one of these two mutually-exclusive states:

    • Success: the operation completed entirely.
    • Failure: the operation could not get through.
    On the other hand, it also holds a non-null value whose meaning totally depends on the semantics defined by the operation:
    • A successful result wraps a value of type S.
    • A failed result wraps a value of type F.

    Result state can be determined via isSuccess or isFailure. Additional methods to unwrap the included value are provided, such as orElse (return an alternative success value if the operation failed) and ifSuccess (execute a block of code if the operation succeeded).

    Author:
    Guillermo Calvo
    See Also:
    com.leakyabstractions.result, Results
    API Note:
    Result is primarily intended for use as a method return type whenever failure is expected and recoverable, and where using null is likely to cause errors. A variable whose type is Result should never itself be null; it should always point to a Result instance.
    Impl Spec:
    This is a value-based type. Instances of classes that implement Result:
    • MUST be final and immutable (though MAY contain references to mutable objects);
    • MUST have implementations of equals, hashCode, and toString which are computed solely from the instance's state and not from its identity or the state of any other object or variable;
    • MUST NOT make no use of identity-sensitive operations such as reference equality (==) between instances, identity hash code of instances, or synchronization on an instances's intrinsic lock;
    • MUST be considered equal solely based on equals(), not based on reference equality (==);
    • MUST NOT have accessible constructors, but SHOULD be instead instantiated through factory methods (such as the ones provided by Results) which make no commitment as to the identity of returned instances;
    • MUST be freely substitutable when equal, meaning that interchanging any two instances x and y that are equal according to equals() in any computation or method invocation SHOULD produce no visible change in behavior.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Result<S,F> filter(Predicate<? super S> predicate, Function<? super S,? extends F> mapper)
      If this is a successful result whose value does not match the given predicate, returns a new failed result with a value produced by the given mapping function; otherwise returns this result.
      <S2,F2> Result<S2,F2> flatMap(Function<? super S,Result<S2,F2>> successMapper, Function<? super F,Result<S2,F2>> failureMapper)
      Returns a new result produced by the appropriate Result-bearing mapping function.
      <F2> Result<S,F2> flatMapFailure(Function<? super F,Result<S,F2>> mapper)
      If this is a failed result, returns a new result produced by the given, Result-bearing mapping function; otherwise returns a successful result with this result's success value.
      <S2> Result<S2,F> flatMapSuccess(Function<? super S,Result<S2,F>> mapper)
      If this is a successful result, returns a new result produced by the given, Result-bearing mapping function; otherwise returns a failed result with this result's failure value.
      F getFailureOrElseThrow()
      If this is a failed result, returns its failure value; otherwise throws NoSuchElementException.
      Result<S,F> ifFailure(Consumer<? super F> action)
      If this is a failed result, performs the given action with its failure value; otherwise does nothing.
      Result<S,F> ifSuccess(Consumer<? super S> action)
      If this is a successful result, performs the given action with its success value; otherwise does nothing.
      Result<S,F> ifSuccessOrElse(Consumer<? super S> successAction, Consumer<? super F> failureAction)
      If this is a successful result, performs the given success action; otherwise performs the given failure action.
      boolean isFailure()
      If this is a failed result, returns true; otherwise false.
      boolean isSuccess()
      If this is a successful result, returns true; otherwise false.
      <S2,F2> Result<S2,F2> map(Function<? super S,S2> successMapper, Function<? super F,F2> failureMapper)
      Returns a new result with the value produced by the appropriate mapping function.
      <F2> Result<S,F2> mapFailure(Function<? super F,F2> mapper)
      If this is a failed result, returns a new failed result with the value produced by the given mapping function; otherwise returns a successful result with this result's success value.
      <S2> Result<S2,F> mapSuccess(Function<? super S,S2> mapper)
      If this is a successful result, returns a new successful result with the value produced by the given mapping function; otherwise returns a failed result with this result's failure value.
      Optional<S> optional()
      If this is a successful result, returns an optional containing its success value; otherwise returns an empty optional.
      Optional<F> optionalFailure()
      If this is a failed result, returns an optional containing its failure value; otherwise returns an empty optional.
      S orElse(S other)
      If this is a successful result, returns its success value; otherwise returns other.
      S orElseMap(Function<? super F,? extends S> mapper)
      If this is a successful result, returns its success value; otherwise returns the value produced by the given mapping function.
      S orElseThrow()
      If this is a successful result, returns its success value; otherwise throws NoSuchElementException.
      <E extends Throwable>
      S      		 orElseThrow(Function<? super F,E> mapper)
      If this is a successful result, returns its success value; otherwise throws an exception produced by the given mapping function.
      Stream<S> stream()
      If this is a successful result, returns a sequential stream containing only its success value; otherwise returns an empty stream.
      Stream<F> streamFailure()
      If this is a failed result, returns a sequential stream containing only its failure value; otherwise returns an empty stream.

        boolean isSuccess()
        If this is a successful result, returns true; otherwise false.
        Returns:
        true if successful; otherwise false
        See Also:

        If this is a failed result, returns true; otherwise false.
        Returns:
        true if failed; otherwise false
        See Also:

      • orElse

        S orElse(S other)
        If this is a successful result, returns its success value; otherwise returns other.
        Parameters:
        other - the possibly-null alternative success value
        Returns:
        this result's success value if successful; otherwise other
        See Also:
        orElseMap(Function)

      • orElseMap

        S orElseMap(Function<? super F,? extends S> mapper)
        If this is a successful result, returns its success value; otherwise returns the value produced by the given mapping function.

        The mapping function will be applied to this result's failure value to produce an alternative success value.

        Parameters:
        mapper - the mapping function that produces the possibly-null alternative success value
        Returns:
        this result's success value if successful; otherwise the value produced by the mapping function
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if this is a failed result and mapper is null
        See Also:
        orElse(Object)

      • orElseThrow

        S orElseThrow()
        If this is a successful result, returns its success value; otherwise throws NoSuchElementException.
        Returns:
        this result's success value
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - if this is a failed result
        See Also:
        getFailureOrElseThrow(), orElseThrow(Function)

      • orElseThrow

        <E extends Throwable> S orElseThrow(Function<? super F,E> mapper)
                             throws E extends Throwable
        If this is a successful result, returns its success value; otherwise throws an exception produced by the given mapping function.

        The mapping function will be applied to this result's failure value to produce an exception.

        Type Parameters:
        E - Type of the exception to be thrown
        Parameters:
        mapper - the mapping function that produces an exception to be thrown
        Returns:
        this result's success value
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if this is a failed result and mapper is null
        E - if this is a failed result
        E extends Throwable
        See Also:
        orElseThrow()

        F getFailureOrElseThrow()
        If this is a failed result, returns its failure value; otherwise throws NoSuchElementException.
        Returns:
        this result's failure value
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - if this is a successful result
        See Also:
        orElseThrow()

        See Also:
        stream()

      • ifSuccess

        Result<S,F> ifSuccess(Consumer<? super S> action)
        If this is a successful result, performs the given action with its success value; otherwise does nothing.
        Parameters:
        action - the action to be applied to this result's success value
        Returns:
        this result
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if this is a successful result and action is null
        See Also:

      • ifSuccessOrElse

        Result<S,F> ifSuccessOrElse(Consumer<? super S> successAction,
                            Consumer<? super F> failureAction)
        If this is a successful result, performs the given success action; otherwise performs the given failure action.
        Parameters:
        successAction - the action to be applied to this result's success value
        failureAction - the action to be applied to this result's failure value
        Returns:
        this result
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if this is a successful result and successAction is null; or if it is failed and failureAction is null

      • filter

        Result<S,F> filter(Predicate<? super S> predicate,
                   Function<? super S,? extends F> mapper)
        If this is a successful result whose value does not match the given predicate, returns a new failed result with a value produced by the given mapping function; otherwise returns this result.

        The mapping function will be applied to this result's success value to produce the failure value.

        Parameters:
        predicate - the predicate to apply to this result's success value
        mapper - the mapping function that produces the failure value
        Returns:
        a new failed result with the value produced by mapper if this is a successful result whose value does not match the given predicate; otherwise this result
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if this is a successful result and predicate is null, or if its success value does not match the predicate and mapper is null; or if mapper returns null

      • map

        <S2,F2> Result<S2,F2> map(Function<? super S,S2> successMapper,
                          Function<? super F,F2> failureMapper)
        Returns a new result with the value produced by the appropriate mapping function.

        Depending on this result's state, one of the two given functions will be applied to its success or failure value to produce a new value. The types of the new success/failure values may be different from this result's.

        Type Parameters:
        S2 - the type of the value returned by successMapper
        F2 - the type of the value returned by failureMapper
        Parameters:
        successMapper - the mapping function that produces a success value
        failureMapper - the mapping function that produces a failure value
        Returns:
        a new result with a value produced by either successMapper or failureMapper
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if this is a successful result and successMapper is null; or if this is a failed result and failureMapper is null; or if either successMapper or failureMapper returns null
        See Also:
        mapFailure(Function), mapSuccess(Function)

      • mapSuccess

        <S2> Result<S2,F> mapSuccess(Function<? super S,S2> mapper)
        If this is a successful result, returns a new successful result with the value produced by the given mapping function; otherwise returns a failed result with this result's failure value.

        The mapping function will be applied to this result's success value to produce the new success value. The type of the new success value may be different from this result's.

        Type Parameters:
        S2 - the type of the value returned by mapper
        Parameters:
        mapper - the mapping function that produces the new success value
        Returns:
        a new successful result with the value produced by mapper if this is a successful result; otherwise a failed result with this result's failure value
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if this is a successful result and mapper is null; or if mapper returns null
        See Also:
        map(Function, Function), mapFailure(Function)

      • mapFailure

        <F2> Result<S,F2> mapFailure(Function<? super F,F2> mapper)
        If this is a failed result, returns a new failed result with the value produced by the given mapping function; otherwise returns a successful result with this result's success value.

        The mapping function will be applied to this result's failure value to produce the new failure value. The type of the new failure value may be different from this result's.

        Type Parameters:
        F2 - the type of the value returned by mapper
        Parameters:
        mapper - the mapping function that produces the new failure value
        Returns:
        a new failed result with the value produced by mapper if this is a failed result; otherwise a successful result with this result's success value
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if this is a failed result and mapper is null; or if mapper returns null
        See Also:
        map(Function, Function), mapSuccess(Function)

      • flatMap

        <S2,F2> Result<S2,F2> flatMap(Function<? super S,Result<S2,F2>> successMapper,
                              Function<? super F,Result<S2,F2>> failureMapper)
        Returns a new result produced by the appropriate Result-bearing mapping function.

        Depending on this result's state, one of the two given functions will be applied to its success or failure value to produce a new result. State and types may be different from this result's.

        Type Parameters:
        S2 - the success type of the result returned by the given functions
        F2 - the failure type of the result returned by the given functions
        Parameters:
        successMapper - the mapping function that produces a new result if this is a successful result
        failureMapper - the mapping function that produces a new result if this is a failed result
        Returns:
        the result produced by either successMapper or failureMapper
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if this is a successful result and successMapper is null; or if this is a failed result and failureMapper is null; or if either successMapper or failureMapper returns null
        See Also:
        flatMapFailure(Function), flatMapSuccess(Function)

      • flatMapSuccess

        <S2> Result<S2,F> flatMapSuccess(Function<? super S,Result<S2,F>> mapper)
        If this is a successful result, returns a new result produced by the given, Result-bearing mapping function; otherwise returns a failed result with this result's failure value.

        The mapping function will be applied to this result's success value to produce a new result. State and success type may be different from this result's.

        Type Parameters:
        S2 - the success type of the result returned by mapper
        Parameters:
        mapper - the mapping function that produces a new result
        Returns:
        the result produced by mapper if this is a successful result; otherwise a failed result with this result's failure value.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if this is a successful result and mapper is null; or if mapper returns null
        See Also:
        flatMap(Function, Function), flatMapFailure(Function)

      • flatMapFailure

        <F2> Result<S,F2> flatMapFailure(Function<? super F,Result<S,F2>> mapper)
        If this is a failed result, returns a new result produced by the given, Result-bearing mapping function; otherwise returns a successful result with this result's success value.

        The mapping function will be applied to this result's failure value to produce a new result. State and failure type may be different from this result's.

        Type Parameters:
        F2 - the failure type of the result returned by mapper
        Parameters:
        mapper - the mapping function that produces a new result
        Returns:
        the result produced by mapper if this is a failed result; otherwise a successful result with this result's success value.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if this is a failed result and mapper is null; or if mapper returns null
        See Also:
        flatMap(Function, Function), flatMapSuccess(Function)
